item.title: Fourth Oklahoma Cine Latino Festival portrays depth of talent, passion
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The 4th Annual Oklahoma Cine Latino Festival opened Friday night back on Capitol Hill where it began, but in a significantly nicer location. The new Capitol Hill Center of Oklahoma City Community College at SW 25th Street and Hudson Avenue was where the festival was held this year. Youth filmmakers The hard work invested by […]

item.title: Youth workshop at full speed as Latino film festival nears
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Student director Jordyn Borrego listened intently over headphones as she watched the camera move into place for a scene in her upcoming film, “Desire.” “Sound. Camera. Action.” The scene started. When it was complete, she said “cut,” and started reviewing what had just been shot. It wasn’t the first take, either. They weren’t having trouble, […]

The post Youth workshop at full speed as Latino film festival nears appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Bellgardt’s “Gremlin” draws posse back to deadCENTER
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Emmy winning local filmmaker Ryan Bellgardt has a loyal following who will show up to see his next film just about every time. After his big hit Army of Frankensteins at the 2013 deadCENTER Film Festival in Oklahoma City, he is back with a more serious, dark movie that falls squarely in the “scary movie” […]

The post Bellgardt’s “Gremlin” draws posse back to deadCENTER appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: deadCENTER crowd enjoys “The Scent of Rain & Lightning”
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
deadCENTER veterans Casey Twenter and Jeff Robison presented one of their latest serious works in the first night of the film festival in Oklahoma City, now in its 17th year. “The Scent of Rain & Lightning was adapted from the novel by Nancy Pickard, which was a new approach for the prolific writer/producer team. Already […]

item.title: Okla Cine Latino Film Festival reveals strong local talent
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The third annual Cine Latino Film Festival entertained a filled UCO CHK Central Boathouse Saturday evening. It revealed the talents of many Oklahoma City filmmakers, actors and actresses. A new feature of the festival this year was the addition of work by local youth filmmakers, the product of workshops held weeks before. Organizers and those […]

The post Okla Cine Latino Film Festival reveals strong local talent appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Into 2017 – Building a screenwriting network in OKC
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The screenwriters panel at the 2016 deadCENTER Film Festival in Oklahoma City featured several people who had various levels of experience at the craft. But one of the panelists stood out by his blunt, but highly informative answers to questions. He was clearly someone wanting to engage the audience right there in Bricktown, not just […]
